sentence.Network_en: The wolf clawed at the tree and howled the whole night.
sentence.Network_cn: 这匹狼用爪子挠着树，嚎叫了整晚。

sentence.Network_en: She clawed at the bushes to disentangle herself.
sentence.Network_cn: 她向灌木丛抓去，想脱身出来。

sentence.Network_en: His fingers clawed at Blake's wrist.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的手指紧紧抓住布莱克的手腕。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 植物学专业词汇港台译法（23） ... 有绉纹的；水泡状 bullate 有爪的 clawed;unguiculate 右 dextra.
They clawed each other in Parliament ., 他们在议会中互相吹捧.
The fox clawed at the hen ., 狐狸用爪子去抓那只母鸡.
Terrestrial carnivores have four or five clawed digits on each limb ., 陆栖食肉动物的前后肢上都长有四个或五个带爪的足趾.

list.abs: 关于水果的英语单词_百度文库 ... （退缩者） 蟹 crab 蟹足 crab claws 小虾（虾米） shrimp.
五金工具类专业术语 ... 奶子锤： ball-pein hammer 羊角锤： claw hammer 钳工锤： mechanic hammer.
译网情深 - 打印文章 - ... 道钉锤 spike hammer 撬棍lining bar ； claw bar 轨道水平尺 track level.
猫爪草(CAT'S CLAW)简介：猫爪草是种木本藤，生长在亚马逊雨林和其它南部和中部的热带区域．它的名字是因为它沿著藤身生长著 …

entry.def: The claws of a bird or animal are the thin, hard, curved nails at the end of its feet.

example.ex: The cat tried to cling to the edge by its claws.
example.tran: 猫试图用爪子抓住边缘。

entry.def: The claws of a lobster, crab, or scorpion are the two pointed parts at the end of its legs which are used for holding things.
If an animal claws at something, it scratches or damages it with its claws.

example.ex: The wolf clawed at the tree and howled the whole night.
example.tran: 这匹狼用爪子挠着树，嚎叫了整晚。

entry.def: To claw at something mean to try very hard to get hold of it.

example.ex: His fingers clawed at Blake's wrist...
example.tran: 他的手指紧紧抓住布莱克的手腕。

example.ex: He stumbled, clawed wildly at the air and fell backwards into the water.
example.tran: 他绊了一脚，双手在空中胡乱抓了几下，然后仰天栽进了水里。

entry.def: If you claw your way somewhere, you move there with great difficulty, trying desperately to find things to hold on to.

example.ex: Some did manage to claw their way up iron ladders to the safety of the upper deck.
example.tran: 的确有人设法抓住铁梯爬上了顶层甲板，脱离了危险。

entry.tran: 不畏艰险地拼搏;坚持不懈地奋斗
entry.def: If someone claws their way to a successful position, they achieve it with great determination in spite of many difficulties.

example.ex: Gino clawed his way out of underworld obscurity to become a millionaire hotelier.
example.tran: 吉诺从底层社会的无名小卒一步步奋斗成为拥有百万家财的酒店大亨。

entry.tran: 影响别人的言行；（尤指）尖刻的言行，令人不愉快的言行
entry.def: If someone gets their claws into another person, they start doing or saying things, especially unpleasant things, which affect that person.

example.ex: She should take her claws out of Tom and let him get on with his life.
example.tran: 她不该再死死地缠着汤姆，应该让他继续自己的生活。

means.word_mean: 1. having a claw or claws; often used as a combining form;

auth_sentence.content: Bloomberg reported the clawed-back salary amount late Thursday.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bloomberg reported the clawed-back salary amount late Thursday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bloomberg reported the clawed-back salary amount late Thursday.

auth_sentence.content: He jumped up and clawed the hell out of the car.
auth_sentence.res_content: He jumped up and clawed the hell out of the car.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He jumped up and clawed the hell out of the car.

auth_sentence.content: First it clawed back Ukraine, then tightened its grip in the Caucasus.
auth_sentence.res_content: First it clawed back Ukraine, then tightened its grip in the Caucasus.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: First it clawed back Ukraine, then tightened its grip in the Caucasus.
